official-title.#text:
Expressing the sense of the House of
		  Representatives that specialty crops are a vital part of agriculture in the
		  United States, that the Committee on Agriculture should propose funding for
		  programs that support specialty crops priorities, and that legislation should
		  be passed that includes funding reflecting specialty crops as a growing and
		  important part of United States agriculture.

cosponsor.#text: Mr. Sean Patrick Maloney of New York

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the following
			 resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: That it is the sense of the

specialty crops
			 are a vital part of agriculture in the United States;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
should propose funding for programs that support specialty crops
			 priorities; and

text.#text: the

legislation should be passed that includes
			 funding reflecting specialty crops as a growing and important part of United
			 States agriculture.
Whereas specialty crops represent more than

fraction.#tail:
of the value of United States crop production in a
			 given year;

text.#text:
Whereas sales of fresh and processed fruits and vegetables
			 total nearly $100,000,000,000 annually;

Whereas combined exports of specialty crops grown in the
			 United States totaled nearly $15,900,000,000 as recently as 2010, which
			 accounts for about 15 percent of all agricultural exports from the United
			 States;

Whereas specialty crops are not eligible for many of the
			 traditional support programs that benefit producers of other crops;

Whereas fruits and vegetables like red raspberries,
			 almonds, apples, apricots, avocados, bananas, beans, blueberries, citrus,
			 cherries, cranberries, figs, grapes, macadamia nuts, nectarines, onions,
			 papayas, peaches, pecans, peppers, plums, potatoes, pumpkins, sweet corn,
			 certain tomatoes, walnuts, asparagus, beets, strawberries, broccoli, and
			 carrots are just a few of the hundreds of specialty crops grown in the United
			 States;

Whereas specialty crops are a driving force in promoting a
			 healthier country and are part of a healthy, balanced diet that can help
			 consumers reach recommended dietary goals, which call for half of plates to be
			 fruits and vegetables;
Whereas the authorities in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that expired on September 30, 2012,
			 were extended under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Food, Conservation, and
			 Energy Act of 2008
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008

text.#text:
Whereas many agriculture programs did not receive any
			 additional mandatory funding under that extension;

Whereas a vital program for specialty
			 crops, the specialty crop research initiative, established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, did not receive any additional mandatory funding under that
			 extension;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 412 of
			 the Agricultural Research, Extension, and Education Reform Act of 1998
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Agricultural Research, Extension, and Education Reform Act of 1998/s:412

text.#text:
Whereas a vital program for specialty
			 crops, the national clean plant network, established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, did not receive any
			 additional mandatory funding under that extension;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 10202 of the
			 Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008/s:10202

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
passes a new 5-year farm bill to reauthorize agriculture programs without
			 funding in fiscal year 2013, to provide funding for such programs in fiscal
			 year 2014 and fiscal years thereafter, and to provide certainty to farmers
			 across the United States;

text.#text: Whereas it is paramount that the

Whereas the number of farms producing and sales of fruits,
			 berries, and tree nuts in the United States is steadily increasing;

Whereas according to the most recent census data published
			 by the

Whereas it is evident that specialty crops are an
			 increasingly important part of agriculture in the United States; and

Whereas specialty crops should get their fair share of
			 consideration and funding in agriculture generally, but especially in the farm
			 bill: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 182 IH: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that specialty crops are a vital part of agriculture in the United States, that the Committee on Agriculture should propose funding for programs that support specialty crops priorities, and that legislation should be passed that includes funding reflecting specialty crops as a growing and important part of United States agriculture.
